title: Cat. 85  Fragment of a Cup, late 1st century B.C./1st century A.D.
publication_title: Roman Art at the Art Institute of Chicago
content:
<section class="osci-tk-epub-section tombstone" id="tombstone">Fragment of a Cup  
Late 1st century B.C./1st century A.D.  
Roman  
Glass, mosaic glass technique; 4.1 × 2.7 × 0.6 cm (1 5/8 × 1 1/16 × 1/4 in.)  
The Art Institute of Chicago, gift of Theodore W. and Frances S. Robinson, 1949.1250

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section curatorial_entry" id="curatorial_entry">Translucent turbid olive-green, brown-to-amethyst, and opaque white and brick-red glass. Cup fragment fabricated by the mosaic glass technique, tooled, and polished. The fragment preserves a small segment of the outsplayed rim and double carinated profile. In an olive-green matrix is a mosaic pattern formed from sections of a single cane in a brown-to-amethyst ground, a central olive-green dot with a concentric red ring surrounded by a ring of nine white dots.

Small segment of rim is preserved, three sides are broken. The edges and back are covered with a thick brown weathering crust and some silver iridescence. The interior has been repolished but still retains some deep pitting and iridescence.  
Sidney Goldstein

</section><section id="figures">Cat. 85 Fragment of a Cup, late 1st century B.C./1st century A.D.

</section>
